revised_title: Investigating the Mechanism of Voluntary Muscular Motion
tldr: The author examines the structure and function of animal muscles, focusing on the role of blood vessels and nerves in voluntary muscular motion. The study includes observations on the structure of muscles, the distribution of blood and nerves, and the effects of blocking blood vessels and nerves on muscle function. The author concludes that voluntary muscular motion requires both a specific muscle structure and the freedom of blood vessels and nerves.
